channel.title: Comments on: Apple Watch + iPhone Charging Station

item.title: By: AndrewFerguson
item.dc:creator: AndrewFerguson
item.description:
I suspect I'm in the minority on this, but I really don't want a watch that I have to charge everyday...even once a week I find hard to swallow. I used to have a Microsoft SPOT watch, and it was okay (minus the fact it kept resetting once a month or so).
I've been wearing a Casio G-Shock Waveceptor/Tough Solar almost non-stop for 6 years now. I've had to replace the band on it about a year ago, and the battery recently hit a point where it doesn't hold enough of a charge (it's solar powered) to get me through the Seattle winter. But it does what I need it to do: tell time accurately to the second (it syncs with WWVB nightly).
It's one less thing I have to worry about.
item.content:encoded:
I suspect I’m in the minority on this, but I really don’t want a watch that I have to charge everyday…even once a week I find hard to swallow. I used to have a Microsoft SPOT watch, and it was okay (minus the fact it kept resetting once a month or so).

I’ve been wearing a Casio G-Shock Waveceptor/Tough Solar almost non-stop for 6 years now. I’ve had to replace the band on it about a year ago, and the battery recently hit a point where it doesn’t hold enough of a charge (it’s solar powered) to get me through the Seattle winter. But it does what I need it to do: tell time accurately to the second (it syncs with WWVB nightly).

It’s one less thing I have to worry about.

item.title: By: alexkingorg
item.dc:creator: alexkingorg
item.description: @chuck415 Sadly, doesn't work with the Milanese Loop; at least that I can tell.
item.content:encoded: @chuck415 Sadly, doesn’t work with the Milanese Loop; at least that I can tell.

item.title: By: dlpasco
item.dc:creator: dlpasco
item.description: @alexkingorg I need a stand for both, too, but, uh, the watch-only model is really cute.

item.title: By: alexkingorg
item.dc:creator: alexkingorg
item.description: @dlpasco I like that too, but I think I want something that handles both. Agreed on the Timber Catchall being the best of the bunch so far.
item.content:encoded: @dlpasco I like that too, but I think I want something that handles both. Agreed on the Timber Catchall being the best of the bunch so far.
